website_summaries.verdict: A good power strip made from a reliable company that comes with a variety of cord lengths and a flat plug head.
pros: Choose cord length from 3 to 10 feet
Flat plug head helps fit more easily behind furniture
Safety closures on empty outlets are easy to engage for use
A good value on a basic power strip
cons: This model includes a blue light that can seem a bit bright at night

customer_reviews.title: Horrible. Almost fought my house on fire!
customer_reviews.text: We only had our tv and cable boxes plugged in. I heard a noise like static to find this was catching on fire! I chose 1 stars for these only because I had to. I give it a fat zero and a fire hazard.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi

customer_reviews.title: didn't hold up in a storm!
customer_reviews.text: For the first two months, we thought this was fine; the protected light was on, everything stayed in place, life was fine. But then we had a storm and the power turned off and back on fairly quickly, but both our gaming system and sound-bar that had been plugged in are no longer functioning. So much for "protected." We wanted this to be so helpful, but it couldn't even last through one storm!
customer_reviews.author: Emma Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Product Picture is Wrong Product
customer_reviews.text: We bought this because we need that flat, square plug that's pictured with the cord going off of the bottom right corner. Instead, we got a round one with a cord going straight down making it useless because of other cords using the same outlet being the way. Really irritating that what's pictured is not at all what we got but is what's advertised. That photo needs to be changed or they need to figure out who screwed up in the ordering process.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not lock, false advertising
customer_reviews.text: There is no locking mechanism on the product. “Twist to close” would be accurate but it no way do the covers lock into place. I would consider the covers then just a nuisance since it offers no protection and is so easily moved into undesired positions. Without an actual “twist to lock” feature this becomes an overpriced, annoying surge protector.
customer_reviews.author: xylopia

customer_reviews.title: Buy!
customer_reviews.text: I first measured out how long I needed the cord to be so that I wouldn't have extra cord laying around. Then I use my wire-staple-gun to secure the cord to the wall neatly. And last I use double-sided-sticky-Velcro and I placed it on the back of the power adapter so that it would hold in place on the wall. Came out very clean!
customer_reviews.author: Gabrielle P.

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. Only issue is that it is somewhat difficult to get the plugs to go in all the way. It's not just one, but all of the outlets are this way on both of the units I purchased. Otherwise, exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Can't use with Echo Dot, Phone Chargers, table lamps!
customer_reviews.text: BEWARE! If you try plugging in a simple, two-pronged plug, such as a table lamp, it won't fit. At first I thought I was doing something wrong, but half-a-dozen friends and family members tried and failed. To clarify the issue, the power strip plugs into the wall outlet with no problem. The appliances you want to use do not fit into the strip unless they have a grounded, three-prong plug. My Echo dots, my phone chargers, and my nightstand lamps will not plug into it. Since I bought two of these for these exact items, I wasted my money, effort, and time.
customer_reviews.author: Zee Lugo

customer_reviews.title: Only one outlet is usable!!!
customer_reviews.text: The cord length was exactly what we needed. We were only using the first outlet and it works great. The return period is over and I needed to plug something in one of the other outlets - the plug will only go in halfway! Very unsafe! Wish I would have tried the other outlets right away. And yes, we tried them in the unlocked position. Now I need to start looking for a better one. I thought GE would be reliable...
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: Will not keep plugs in.
customer_reviews.text: This power strip is as bad as it can be while still being functional enough to not be worth replacing. The problem is this: it will not keep plugs in. Any slight pull on a cord will disengage the plug from the strip, often only enough to keep the power from working. The number of times I've woken up to an uncharged phone because the plug has come slightly out is too many. Power runs to it. I assume it works to protect against surges (But have not experienced any). But gosh darn is this thing frustrating. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: E. Brizzolara

customer_reviews.title: After 2 mos of use, this just broke.
customer_reviews.text: Been using for 2 mos without issue. A few days ago the LED flickered and then went out. I tried the switch but it would not come back on and would not output power. I checked the wall socket, which was fine, so this product simply didn't last. It's been underneath my couch and was barely touched except for when plugging in phone chargers, laptops, etc.
customer_reviews.author: SA

customer_reviews.title: GE - Gory Electronics
customer_reviews.text: My tv has issues turning on (clicks over and over for up to 5 minutes before turning on) when connected to this surge protector. It works fine when plugging it into the wall or any other surge protector.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Piece of crap. Plugs have to be wiggled into place. Last one dies after 4 months. We don't make anything anymore. I guess I should try to find an extension cord at n antique store or make one myself.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Pacetti

customer_reviews.title: Socket positioning doesn't allow for full use of the power strip
customer_reviews.text: Okay, my bad for not looking more closely before buying, but while overall this is a fine power strip and I like the 10' cord option, the sockets all point toward the bottom of the strip vs. out to the side. The issue is if you have a large transformer, like with an apple product, or a flat plug, like with most monitors, it seems the cord for each will cover the socket next to the one you are using, whereas if the sockets were turned to point sideways you could use all six outlets. As a result, this 6-outlet power strip can turn quickly into a three outlet strip, or four if you are lucky (see picture).
customer_reviews.author: Chris R

customer_reviews.title: Great for open areas
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Only complaint when you plug something in it will not always go in all the way and requires extra force to get the plug all the way in. Great for open areas, but hard to use if tucked away under desk.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Arrived damaged.
customer_reviews.text: Whoever packed this, crammed it into the box. Thats probably the reason it doesnt work. Tried different outlets and everything. No luck.
customer_reviews.author: Emma FlenerTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Quality item, and well made!
customer_reviews.text: Quality item!! Very nice thick sturdy cord, rotating outlets to keep out dust & debris. We ran this behind our sofa over to the wall plug and slid it up under the edge. We needed the length, but not quite as many outlets. We can pull it out and turn on when needed. Switch lights up when on and is off when power is off. Definitely a must have item with a couple of teens around and they always need a charger!! One glance is all you need to be sure it is off and not using electricity.
customer_reviews.author: jules

customer_reviews.title: Plugs rotate to close ONLY
customer_reviews.text: Probably mea culpa here, but this is not a rotating socket power strip. I was under the impression you could plug cables in in different orientations. Nope. Also the mounting holes do not allow you to mount this unit cord DOWN. The only way you cannot mount it, and the only way I wanted to mount it. Lazy design. Most have at least two orientations to cover all 4 possible mounting directions. Best to look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: jkuhn

customer_reviews.title: Finally!
customer_reviews.text: Having a surge protector with a 10-foot cord may not seem like a big deal, but it is. I'd never been able to find one with a cord longer than 3 feet! I live in an old house that doesn't have a lot of outlets; the "box" has been updated so the house can handle the demand on the electricity, but that didn't give me more outlets. This allows me to plug in as many lights, and devices that I need without having to arrange my furniture so that everything is close to an outlet. Never seen one before - until I looked on Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Crowded sockets are a problem
customer_reviews.text: The cable length is great, and the quality is good. However, the sockets are so close together that only very narrow plugs will fit next to each other. Adaptors will cover 2-3 sockets each.
customer_reviews.author: Cyn Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Limited Lifetime Warranty is a joke
customer_reviews.text: Initial impressions - PROS: Seems well made. Heavy duty cord, although rather stiff. Wings around switch reduce risk of accidental shut off. CONS: Blue light is big and bright - annoying in a bedroom. The "Limited Lifetime Warranty" is a joke. It basically says - all surge protectors wear out ... "In this event, the Limited-Lifetime Warranty is no longer valid and the surge protector should be replaced."
customer_reviews.author: R. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Well-made extension cord and surge protector from GE
customer_reviews.text: This GE extension cord and 6 plug surge protector arrived as described. The cord length is indeed 15' and the item included 6 individual 3-prong outlets. Each outlet has a twist-lock design that keeps the outlets closed when not in use. I suppose this is a safety feature to keep young children from inserting objects into the unused outlets. Either way, they work as intended. Please note that the outlets are not designed to swivel themselves...they only rotate to allow opening/closing. You cannot adjust the prong direction to account for oddly shaped plugs. There is a blue light that indicates whether the surge protector is on/off. It is bright but not too intense that it becomes obnoxious or annoying.
customer_reviews.author: PharmaGuy

customer_reviews.title: Doubles as a nightlight and cat toy.
customer_reviews.text: I must have missed this. I plugged it in during the day. Later, when I went to bed, i rolled over and shot straight up. I thought something happened. Intruder? No. Fire? No. ET? No. It was the dang light. This would work for someone that is “too old” for a night light but doesn’t want to admit it. Oh, if you have a cat, your night will even be more fun. The five stars for this product are really from the cat. I shoved the darn thing under the bed and the cat attacked it knocking everything attached to it down.
customer_reviews.author: CafeMamiTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: the plugs keep falling out
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the idea of being able to plug in a lot of things on my that are on my television stand. I have the cable box, a battery charger hidden behind the TV, and a digital clock, for what ever reason, the inlets are loose and things keep getting unplugged. I don't know it is from vibrations from road traffic or the where you plug them in aren't tight.
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: Typical GE product
customer_reviews.text: I hate GE products. I try never to buy GE products because EVERY TIME I DO, THEY FAIL! I chumped off and bought this because I really needed a short multiplug surge protector, I didn't want to break quarantine, and there just wasn't a lot of choice on Amazon. I plugged my microwave into this piece of &$#@!. It then proceeded to emit a loud buzzing noise from the microwave itself every time we used it. I thought that it was the microwave and that it was about to blow up. Then my son accidentally moved the surge protector and the buzzing went away. Yeah, it was the GE surge protector. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: Floyd

customer_reviews.title: GE quality going downhill
customer_reviews.text: GE quality is getting worse over time. They are trying to maximize their profits but sacrificing the quality of their products. The safety caps do not lock into place which is quite useless for child proofing. The power button is very poorly made so turning on and off the power too often might break the power button. It is also quite difficult to plug into the sockets as if the plastic case and the internal components are not aligned.
customer_reviews.author: Chris swan

customer_reviews.title: Super bright blue switch light!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item because it has long cord. I like it overall but the small bright blue light above switch really bothers me in the dark! I had to put dark tape over it.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great the only thing is I got this one because it was shown as having a straight in plug and it didn’t it has an angled plug but I made it work anyway just doesn’t look as good cause I have to plug it in upside down my outlet is upside down with the single prong at the top.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: 7/10/2020: Purchased this a bit back and use it for my desk area. I've had no issues, and the long cord has been helpful to get behind my furniture where the outlet is blocked by the bulk. The circles don't always return automatically to closed, but as I don't have any issues with needing child safety, I'm good, and if so it'd be easy to close them again anyways. My devices keep a charge that I charge from them. The only thing that would make the outlet even better would be some USB ports! :D
customer_reviews.author: Denise L

customer_reviews.title: Built well, works well
customer_reviews.text: Everything is built very well, from the bulky power strip to the cord and wall plug. The sideways wall plug was exactly what I needed to save space behind a desk and against the wall. The 10ft length is great, though due to the nature of the thick cable, it is hard to bend when you don't need all 10ft.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Liu

customer_reviews.title: No protection whatsoever
customer_reviews.text: At the first storm, it "protected" so well that my computer's power switch fried. Cost me $250 for repair.
customer_reviews.author: Carla

customer_reviews.title: Plug does not match image in the listing
customer_reviews.text: I read several reviews before buying this that the plug received wasn’t the same as the pictured plug, but I thought I’d take a chance. I was one of the unlucky ones. The cable goes straight down rather than to the side preventing you from having this plugged in on the top of an outlet. I was able to rearrange things and it works out, so it’s not worth returning it, but beware: the product you receive has a good chance on not being the same product pictured in the listing.
customer_reviews.author: Jas and Joce

customer_reviews.title: Fried my sound system and almost started a house fire
customer_reviews.text: Just like the reviewer from a few months ago, this almost started a house fire. I plugged it into the wall, plugged in my laptop and a computer speaker system, and immediately started hearing a weird static-like noise. Within a minute, white smoke started pouring from my subwoofer and I smelled burning plastic. I unplugged everything, but had to air my house out for the whole day, and my sound system is fried. The sound system that lasted me 8 years with absolutely no issues, plugged into an older, shorter power strip. Absolutely horrible, dangerous product. It cost me $45 for new computer speakers, and ruined my day.
customer_reviews.author: J. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Plug is NOT at 45 degrees as shown.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this specifically for the flat plug end at 45 degrees as the item shows. That is not what was on the product. See pics where instead of the square 45 degree it is a Ln extended round straight down plug. That renders the lower plug unaccessible. I need this in the top outlet of the duplex plug as I already had one like this in the bottom. I'll use this for something else as it looks to be a sturdy strio but not what was offered or expected.
customer_reviews.author: John Atkins

customer_reviews.title: Works great of course, but the cord is stiff
customer_reviews.text: The cord is still and it's not the most attractive power adapter. I'm not upset by it since it's just a surge protector, but something like the designer line is just a lot nicer. Also, this one has a really stiff cord so it's hard to get it sit flush against the wall, but considering it's a powerful surge protector I will give it a pass. Overall 4/5, just wish it was more pleasant to look at.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: Of the six outlets, five of them didn't allow a plug to be fully inserted. Huge fire hazard if one doesn't notice. Not the quality I would expect, especially from a GE product. And I choose it over Amazon Basics (and paid considerably more) because I wanted the higher quality. Replacement one was fine, but disappointing and frustrating and makes me question the quality of other things in the surge protector.
customer_reviews.author: megan braga

customer_reviews.title: Not all versions are the same item
customer_reviews.text: Be warned. Not all of the options are flat plugs. I searched for a flat plug extension cord and found this. I didn’t need the six foot so choose the 2 foot version, added it to my cart and went on my way. When it arrived, the plug was NOT flat. I went back and checked and there are various versions listed under this one product. Very confusing.
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: Had to buy another after my bird chewed the cord
customer_reviews.text: This power strip is great, worked perfectly until my bird chewed the plastic off part of the cord, making it unsafe to use (and thankfully she didn’t hurt herself). So I’m on my second power strip of the same type and will keep a much closer eye on her when she’s hanging out by the cord! I love how the outlet covers rotate so nothing can get inside them (ideal in my bird room to keep out feather dust or food debris). The blue light is also handy as a night light so the birds don’t freak out as easily if they’re startled in the dark. Overall great power strip, hope this one lasts longer than the first!
customer_reviews.author: Primer

customer_reviews.title: Return Right, is that what you need?
customer_reviews.text: I like the extension chord as it mainly meets my needs. As described, it's 6 feet long, it has the locking outlets, and it is flat. The one thing the ad doesn't mention is that although the chord is flat, the chord angles to the right, which may be issue depending on your application. In my case I needed the chord to angle left, (or down) so that I could have a cleaner look. Not a major issue in the greater scheme of things, but it would have been nice to have the information, and/or to have the option to select the return angel.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo H

customer_reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For
customer_reviews.text: While I had to give this 5 stars for its 10' cord length, it gets only two stars overall. After just over a year of use, one of the sockets failed when I inserted a plug slightly crooked. This is just a symptom of its overall inexpensive design. The supposed safety caps that twist to cover the outlets don't lock into place, as noted by another reviewer. The cord is a relatively stiff PVC, but is functional enough. The blue light when it has power is annoying, as noted by a different reviewer, but not intolerably so in the day. Overall, if you need an inexpensive, probably not very good at surge protection, power strip, then this is for you!
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Grembowski

customer_reviews.title: I love these surge strips!!!
customer_reviews.text: I now own several of these in varying outlet numbers and cord lengths. I live in a location where power outages and brown outs are not uncommon. We’ve not had a power surge since I purchased these, but I have no concerns on their abilities to protect my items. The flat-to-wall plugs are great and fit easily behind furniture. The twist outlet covers are great for keeping dust and debris (I’m remodeling my house) out. I honestly don’t plan on buying a different brand any time soon! (As with any surge strip, you do need to replace them after a power surge)
customer_reviews.author: J. E.

customer_reviews.title: NOT a flat head plug in
customer_reviews.text: Not as advertised. It is suppose to be a flat head plug but when I recieved it, it's actually a normal regular head that is NOT flat
customer_reviews.author: DKG

customer_reviews.title: Fits my need well
customer_reviews.text: However, I took one star off because the blue LED shines very brightly and is therefore a nuisance in a bedroom. Not every power strip is installed in a well lit office. Mine is installed behind the headboard of our bed to power our projector, Echo, and USB outlets for our phones. Even from behind the bed, the blue LED lit up the whole room with the lights off. Simple fix: put black electrical tape over it (but I shouldn't have to is the point)
customer_reviews.author: DeepThought

customer_reviews.title: Very cheap and difficult to get plugs into outlets
customer_reviews.text: The outlets are supposed to turn when not in use to be child protected. Several don't turn at all. Can't get plugs in 3 of the holes without very forcefully pushing it in. Seems to be very cheap. Returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Plug came exactly as pictured
customer_reviews.text: Some reviewers said that the plug they received is not the flat one as described/pictured on the product page so I was hesitant when ordering. Thankfully, the one I received is exactly as pictured, with a square flat plug. The cord itself is a bit thicker than I thought, but that is not an issue for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny K.

customer_reviews.title: overall rating: DON'T BUY THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: from the looks of things, it seems like it works. i bought it in May thinking it would solve my problems, but it instead MADE THINGS WORSE. firstly, the head is weird and plugs in from one side. it's a really weird product, and the only good thing about it is the fact that it's very long. but it gets worse. IT STOPPED WORKING IN 1 MONTH. i am honestly so shocked. the light stopped turning on yesterday, and it's COMPLETELY DEAD. to make matters even worse, I CAN'T RETURN IT BECAUSE OF AMAZON POLICIES. such a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Chinaelo

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I needed a surge protector with a longer cord and wanted one that plugs in flush to the wall. This fit the bill and was relatively easy to mount. I would have liked it more if it came with a drilling template but w/e. Cons No USB ports which I overlooked when buying. Not a huge deal. Doesn’t have a spaced out port for bigger power bricks. All plugs are in a line vs perpendicular to each other. Power bricks will take up multiple plugs All in all, this fit the bill for the price I wanted to pay. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: E. N. M.

customer_reviews.title: I don't love this power strip.
customer_reviews.text: I don't love this power strip because 1) the cord is so ridiculously stiff I can't get it to open up or lay flat, 2) the 3 prong plug areas are pointing in a direction that is opposite what my larger plug items need, causing me to have to cover up 3 outlets with just 1 item, and 3) the super bright blue light that beams out and disturbs my sleep (I had to figure out a way to cover it up).
customer_reviews.author: Dragonfly

customer_reviews.title: Not a quality product
customer_reviews.text: These were purchased for stage power because of the length of the cord and the name of the manufacturer which used to mean quality. I purchased two of them. One works decent, but has one of the outlets that does not work with any 2 or 3 prong cable plugged in. The other one has 3 that do not work with any cable. I would of returned them but it was past that point with Amazon. DO NOT PURCHASE!!! These are NOT a quality product. These should not be for sale. Pretty sure they are not a safe product.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip A. Lamb

customer_reviews.title: Powers up well
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that the plugs rotate but the wall plug is a bit hard to navigate if you aren't looking directly at it so trying to plug it in behind say a shelf is tough. It seems to work well and everything I've plugged in seems to get plenty of power. The socket is secure enough to where a little tug on your phone charger wont unplug it. My main issue and reason for minus one star is the fact that the power switch lights up very bright to the point where it illuminates the whole room in the dark
customer_reviews.author: Katheryn c

customer_reviews.title: Good bargin.
customer_reviews.text: I needed an extension cord and power strip/surge protector. I wanted a strong, tough cord with 12ga. wires that would stand up to a high power load if needed. This seems to be just what I was looking for. The 10' cord is big and tough, the strip isn't too big and has the covers to close off individual power receptacles to keep trash out. A good product worth the money. I regret that I didn't get a black one though. So far no problems at all. Don't expect any because of the way this product is made. Worth the price and the shipping time is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry L

customer_reviews.title: Low quality
customer_reviews.text: Two of the outlets are barely usable. The contacts are misaligned and make it nearly impossible to insert a plug. Very low quality product. Cheap, lightweight construction that feels like it's going to fall apart. I purchased two powerstrips and both have the same problems. My 30 year old powerstrip is much higher quality.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Like the flat plug and surge protection.  Cord is really heavy
customer_reviews.text: Nice heavy duty multiple outlet extension cord. The flat plug is great to have as well as the surge protection. the only downside I have with it is that the cord is very large and thick. Which is a good thing if you're having a lot of power going through the wires. Just not very flexible
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: This item does not work
customer_reviews.text: I used this product in my kitchen to plug in my NuWave cooktops and a week ago the power surged in my trailer causing the power surge or not to work and it burnt out both my cooktops.
customer_reviews.author: Classydame75

customer_reviews.title: Flat plug is great
customer_reviews.text: I really like this surge protector. I bought it because of the flat plug. The one I had a work stuck straight out and my rolling files kept getting caught on it, so this one is a great improvement. The only reason I’m giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is because it is hard to push the plugs all the way into the surge protector strip. Fortunately, I won’t be needing to do a lot of plugging and unplugging, but if I did, that would be a big drawback. You never want to feel like you’re forcing a plug into the receptacle.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte

customer_reviews.title: Think of this like a 3-Outlet Power Strip if your devices have larger plugs
customer_reviews.text: The power strip works well. I bought a 6-Outlet power strip. The twist-to-close safety design doesn’t provide enough space between the outlets when things are plugged-in. The design should have twisted to open at 90 degrees to the power strip and not parallel to it. Thus, plugs with long bases remain on the power strip to obstruct adjacent outlet instead of being suspended outside of it. This is thus an essentially 3-outlet power Strip for me.
customer_reviews.author: Davoncci

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Great cord length! Awesome price for a two pack. They have little covers that you can turn to close off the unused plugs which is great! They could be a bit more sturdy turning them so it's not good for "child protectant" but still great to have it! Very convenient plug in for the wall, its flat and has the cord go down rather than straight out of the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget

customer_reviews.title: Extend the Plugging
customer_reviews.text: Length was perfect for where my plug is to where I have my computer table at. Measured the length before purchase and it came as measured. 6 plugs facing the same way. But if you have a long rectangle head it covers the other plug unless you plug it at the end. So the only thing that I did not like was it doesn’t rotate in circles so any plugs can fit. If it did that... this extension cord would be perfect. Also has a surge protector light in it which is good because I plug my computer on there.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Decent divider for decent price
customer_reviews.text: I was gonna get a more expensive divider for the office, but realized that my boyfriend needs one, too, and since I didn't want to spend $40+ on extension chords, I looked around some more and found this one based on reasonable reviews. The up side is that it's affordable, handles basic office needs, and seems to be of good quality. The one downside is that the LED indicator light on the strip is rather blinding, but we fixed that with a piece of electrical tape slapped over the top.
customer_reviews.author: xayc

customer_reviews.title: Fake used product.
customer_reviews.text: I already posted a review indicating that the item I received was NOT what is described/sold. I ordered a new GE surge protector extension cord. What I received was not GE or new. It was a rip off cheaply made item. I don’t understand why my first review was taken down?
customer_reviews.author: artistic_baller

customer_reviews.title: Great cord length, annoying light
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the cord length since the only outlet on the wall was behind a dresser. It serves its purpose. The only issue is that since it is in our bedroom next to my wife's side of the bed, she has complained that the blue power light makes it hard to sleep. The spinning child locks also feel a bit cheap, but we don't use them since we don't have children. Overall it's okay if you are on a budget and need the longer cord.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon W

customer_reviews.title: I'll pay more for better quality
customer_reviews.text: The 1st one I bought worked well. The 2nd one I bought would not turn off (switch was faulty). Which is the main reason I bought it, as I prefer to turn off most appliances when I leave the house. I emailed the company twice after contacting amazon. They never responded. It took a month and 4 attempts to reach them before amazon offered a refund. I will now replace the 1st. As It is my opinion that the company tried to avoid the issue. And after reading the reviews of this cord catching fire or melting, I've decide I want to replace the 1st one.
customer_reviews.author: Team faster

customer_reviews.title: Real Solid
customer_reviews.text: Seems like very high quality and good value for price. Its FAR nicer and better than other cords, non surge strips, and surge strips I have that were anywhere from a few dollars cheaper to many dollars more expensive. This was definitely the best purchase. I like the little doors that swivel to cover unused sockets. Be aware it is designed to plug into a wall. The plug is well designed for that - it is low profile. However if you're plugging this in to another strip of some sort or need it adjacent to other plugs it might not fit well.
customer_reviews.author: IIBuc_NastyII

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: The plugs take little more pressure to go in due to safety plug covers. The on off main switch is crap. It wiggles too much and doesn't stay on all the time
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Turn OFF
customer_reviews.text: I screwed this to my CNC router's bench. I have the the router, shopvac, and the CNC controller plugged into this. I assumed the switch marked RESET/OFF could be used as a "Master Off" switch for all of my equipment, but I noticed one night that the blue light was on. I tried to turn it off, but it kept turning itself back on. I believe it was cold temperature related. Luckily I kept the shopvac and router switches in the off position. Now I unplug everything from the surge protector when not in use. I'm going to replace it with something else.
customer_reviews.author: AA

customer_reviews.title: Not a flat plug
customer_reviews.text: Pay attention when picking the cord length, not all size come with a flat plug. The initial description said “flat plug”, I chose the length I needed, but it turned out that the 2ft. and 3ft. strips come with not flat plug (it sticks out almost 5”). I was ordering from my phone and didn’t notice in the picture that the 2 ft. strip was shown with a not flat plug. Normally I would expect the strip to have a different design just because the it’s a ft. shorter. It’s a bit annoying to deal with the exchange, otherwise it’s good.
customer_reviews.author: Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Looks and Feels High-End
customer_reviews.text: This surge protector was an easy sell for me based upon the cord length. It's so hard to find these with cords longer than 3-6 feet! In some cases that's long enough, but to have those few extra feet can make all the difference in a room with fewer plugs! It works really well and I've yet to run into any functionality issues with either of the units I purchased. I could easily recommend these to other buyers in the market for an item like this.
customer_reviews.author: DDR

customer_reviews.title: "Expired" within 6 months of use
customer_reviews.text: Order this product. I plugged 2 items into it, no where near 800 joule usage. All of a sudden it died on me and stopped working. I contacted amazon support and they said to contact the manufacturer Jasco. I just spoke to Jasco and they said, that is normal, they are made to expire, and could not help me any further. They told me it is time for me to buy a new one. Pathetic customer service for an even worse product. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: Justin M.

customer_reviews.title: Flat Plug & Long Cord -- Perfect for tight spaces
customer_reviews.text: My apartment has some spaces blocked by furniture where it'd be convenient to have access to the outlets but would look odd with the furniture sticking out for a non-flat plug. Examples, where I've used these power strips, are in my bedroom behind the bed, and in the living room behind the TV. The individual outlets have covers which are twistable, to prevent dust and other things from touching the outlets, which is a great safety feature.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: Nice Long Cord
customer_reviews.text: I like that I was able to get this with a 10' cord so I could easily route it to where I needed it. There are covers that can be rotated for child protection and to keep dust out of the outlets. I also like that the protection light is noticeable but it is not too bright that it lights up the room. There are plenty of outlets and they are nicely spaced to allow various sizes of plugs to be used.
customer_reviews.author: Dman97

customer_reviews.title: Power button broke.
customer_reviews.text: Nice length, works as advertised. Taking on star off as the blue light is a little too bright and is obnoxious. I had to stick on masking tape to hide it. 9/10 Edit: Failed as of 5/19. I've had to wrap weight and tape around to keep the power on. Good while worked.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: BAD!!!! DANGEROUS!!!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY!!!! No stars from me!!! Static Noise!!!Thank God I caught it. Pray my appliances are ok! They seem ok so far. Same review from others. Look under 1 star ratings
customer_reviews.author: Great

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to like this...
customer_reviews.text: Really wanted to give this 5 stars, has flat plug going into the wall that also swivels. Was good the first four months. On the fifth month it started to frequently trip the internal breaker. Even narrowed it down to just 1 item(air purifier/fan) using the entire power strip. Still trips hours later, sometimes minutes later. Seemed to vary depending on ambient temps.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Love this power strip.
customer_reviews.text: I've finally found a good power strip with a decent length cord. There have been too many instances of appliances with cords that couldn't quite reach the strip. Not any longer. The 8 foot cord on this strip will easily reach some of your appliances that are a just a bit out of the way. I purchased several power strips.
customer_reviews.author: MsShop77

customer_reviews.title: Love the flat plug
customer_reviews.text: It's a surge protector, so difficult to provide a review you haven't read. However, the flat plug is a game changer, honestly. Gone are the days of having to keep your furniture an extra three inches from the wall. If you use the flag plug, it's far more furniture-friendly. Additionally, the 10-foot cable is a huge plus because it can be placed where it's needed with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Glidden

customer_reviews.title: Product voltage rating
customer_reviews.text: My home is in Canada and I ordered the item in Hong Kong (work based). It is a lapse on my part not to check the voltage rating thinking most of these items are on auto voltage rating (110V~240V / 50~60Hz). Upon plugging mine "boom"! Gone not even in 60 seconds. I can still probably use it replacing the the fuse inside but would not bother considering the purchase price. Product description / specification should at least mention the power specs. Probably a good product but future buyers please take note before clicking "Order".
customer_reviews.author: 0re0

customer_reviews.title: Cord is thick, case is heavy plastic - durable construction.
customer_reviews.text: This is a solidly-made device, and it will take some very serious abuse to do any damage to it. Each socket has a rotating cover for child-proofing the outlets not in use. Only downside is the tight spacing between the outlets. There's barely room for standard 3-prong plugs to sit side-by-side, and most "wall wart" transformers will block off at least two of them.
customer_reviews.author: J. P. Demers

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Like many women I need tons of plugs at my vanity. Unfortunately my vanity sit next to my entertainment center, and I didn’t want to overload one plug with all my gadgets. Soooooo...I ordered this so I could have a dedicated set of plugs on its own wall plug. This did the trick. It sits flush to the wall and runs the perfect length around the corner and to the back of my vanity.
customer_reviews.author: Christi Marie

customer_reviews.title: Kitchen helper!
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this a lot more now that we're 'sheltering in place' from the coronavirus and I'm cooking nearly every day. It really is helpful. I have a tiny kitchen, with one counter that's large enough for my microwave, slow cooker and toaster. Unfortunately, the closest outlet is placed just far enough away so that the appliances would have to be almost in the sink to be used. Now I don't have to worry!
customer_reviews.author: Annie O.

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality, No Miracles
customer_reviews.text: Others complain about what this doesn't have, but for the price I didn't expect extra features. I just wanted a power strip and I didn't want to pay a lot for it. This one doesn't make my TV bigger or perform other miracles. It just works. It has a nice, long thick power cord and the places you plug cords in swivel--for safety I guess. If I find I need more of these which is possible with the dearth of outlets where I am living at the moment; I will not hesitate to buy another GE Power Strip just like this one.
customer_reviews.author: Serena

customer_reviews.title: So convenience
customer_reviews.text: The cord length is prefect for me to charging my electronic products. It has 6 spots for charging, and you can closed the spot if you not using it, which is very safe. The characteristic of this patch panel is its socket arrangement, which is not easily affected by their positions like other traditional cords. No matter in the process of using or storing, I enjoy the convenience brought to me by this charging power strip.
customer_reviews.author: pie

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality, Switch in Particular
customer_reviews.text: In most/average use cases, one extension cord is just as good as another. However, when you go to great lengths to permanently install and secure the entire cable to the wall and then the switch breaks during regular use after only a couple of months, it suddenly becomes a rather large pain in the ass. For the biggest name in electric, GE's lowest tier products should still be of higher quality than this.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Duke

customer_reviews.title: Cord get hot. Possible danger
customer_reviews.text: The length of the cord was adequate for my needs. However, it gets very hot. I am afraid that it may be dangerous and become a fire hazard. I unplugged it and it cooled down quickly. Once again, a piece of trash purchased from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: anonymously

customer_reviews.title: Solid unit
customer_reviews.text: I know this won't really protect from most truly disastrous surges... it's mostly just a multi-outlet for me. But the turnable outlets is nice, and optional covering to "close" an outlet is also a good feature. The cord is not too bendy, which is inconvenient for me trying to snake it through a cord channel but I think it reflects good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a very long life span.
customer_reviews.text: This thing worked great for 5 months and today it started making a terrible buzzing noise and it sparked when I tried putting a plug in. It only had two plugs total. A real bummer because otherwise it was study. I loved that it has a flat plug. Sadly I’m going to by a different brand to replace this. My ikea extension cords have lasted years in comparison. I’m really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Ellen

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous Short Cord With Security
customer_reviews.text: I needed a surge protector power strip for my sewing table that is in front of an outlet & didn’t need a long cord — I only needed more outlets. This 2ft cord is PERFECT. I have both more outlets & surge protection for my sewing machine, lamp, iron, etc. Although I wish it had a flat plug, it wasn’t a necessity. Item arrived in perfect condition.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: GE never disappoints
customer_reviews.text: GE never disappoints. I guess thats what brands are all about. I love the fact that you can lock the unused receptacles which a small thing but being an electrical engineer i admire the safety design. Material seems to be very sturdy and the 12/3 cable cable is also on point. Easily mountable and a good touch with the switch and the led.
customer_reviews.author: Shivang desai

customer_reviews.title: Surge and protect!
customer_reviews.text: Works as intended! One plug running a window unit for AC and some interior lighting and charging cords. Other plug is running gaming console, tv, laptop, and stereo. No problems as of yet but i will update if necessary. Got 2 for a great price! Always check your voltage and research before buying anything. Also loving the flat plug.
customer_reviews.author: Kipp Baker

customer_reviews.title: PLUG NOT OFFSET AS DISPLAY AD SHOWS
customer_reviews.text: The flat/offset plug head indicated in display ad photo is not what shipped- The main reason for that feature is not to block the lower outlet in multi-outlet set up.-This flat plug is straight down and NOT offset to the right. Why bother to show pictures if not accurate?
customer_reviews.author: DESERT-TEK

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I need an extension cord that could clear my queen size bed because the power socket is behind the head board. The flat plug I feel is the best part as moving on the bed doesn't rub up against it and cause it to get unplugged from the wall. I use it to charge my devices and power my computer and it works perfectly. plugs fit nice and snug so moving it around if you have to stuff doesn't get unplugged.
customer_reviews.author: William Croysdill

customer_reviews.title: Nice cord length!
customer_reviews.text: The only power outlet in my laundry room is behind the washer and dryer, so I bought this outlet strip with the nice long cord and routed it from the wall outlet through a series of Command cord clips around to the front of the dryer, where the strip is mounted to the wall. Now I have a place I can plug in my cordless vac to charge easily, and if for any reason I need to unplug the strip the cord won't fall behind the dryer where it's unreachable. Win!
customer_reviews.author: Melody L

customer_reviews.title: When Price Is Of The Essence
customer_reviews.text: The whole thing has a plastic feel to it even though it is of course made with plastic. Penetration to the wall plug and individual sockets can be much smoother. Sounds good, but there is really no need to have a cover on each socket. The blue monitor light is an interesting twist. Would be willing to pay more for a better-built version.
customer_reviews.author: Willy

customer_reviews.title: Handy Extra Outlet
customer_reviews.text: I needed additional outlets for a lamp and digital frames on a table top, so I didn't need a cord that was six or eight feet long. This one, 3 feet long, was just right! If there is a drawback to this product, it is that the on/off switch has a guard that makes me turn it on and off with my hand instead of just touching it with a toe.
customer_reviews.author: Alton L Biggs

customer_reviews.title: Short circuited on first use. Poor quality control.
customer_reviews.text: The first time we plugged it in (without any devices plugged into it), there was a loud pop, and flash from the outlet nearest the power switch. We immediately unplugged it, and when we plugged it in again, it was dead (would not turn on). Very disappointing and slightly frightening.
customer_reviews.author: Plus Laboratory

customer_reviews.title: more child friendly than most
customer_reviews.text: When you plug something into this strip, there is a positive click that seems to lock plugs in so they don't easily partially slide out like with most other power strips I've used. The light is bright, but I used electrical tape to black it out. The cord is flatter than most and adequately flexible. It's higher quality than I expected. Given the current discount price, I'm buying another.
customer_reviews.author: Chris G

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as shown, great value, poor job in shipping packaging
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly as shown, which is a nice quality well-made product. The shipping packaging was not good as basically the outlet box was put into a bigger box. When I opened the box the outlet box bottom was open and the outlets hanging out. Come on Amazon, you can do better with the wrapping!
customer_reviews.author: alpop

customer_reviews.title: bad luck
customer_reviews.text: this item didn't work and I used the cord to replace a cord on a nother machine.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Hinton

customer_reviews.title: Plug Proximity
customer_reviews.text: This is a well-made surge suppressor, which we bought for use on our deck, somewhat exposed to potential moisture. It looks nice, and we like the protective weather flaps for each plug, but the problem is that the plugs are too close together, so if you have a power supply for a device, rather than a simple plug, it will consume 2 slots. Overall, we like it, but I wouldn't buy this one again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a well made power strip.
customer_reviews.text: Not a quality power strip. The sockets are difficult to plug into, like there’s something in the holes blockingbthe prongs. How does it make it to retail with such a flaw? Who knows. Will stay away from GE strips in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Northumbrian

customer_reviews.title: Do not match stock photos
customer_reviews.text: The flar plug is angled at 45degree instead of 90degree as shown in the picture. Cord is dirty as if it was used.
customer_reviews.author: Hy Dang

customer_reviews.title: Not durable at all
customer_reviews.text: Used the cord for a very short time before the rubber insulation wore out and started sparking. Very soft exterior that does not hold up to normal wear and tear. It was run from the couch to a plug underneath and within a few days shorted out and could've caused a fire. If durability is what you are looking for, this is not for you. Also, it is not lockable like advertised. The cover just spins freely, which would be easily accessible by a child.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan

product_meta.title: GE 6 Outlet Surge Protector, 10 Ft Extension Cord, Power Strip, 800 Joules, Flat Plug, Twist-to-Close Safety Covers, White, 14092
product_meta.description: Color:White| Size:10 ft| Style:One PackConnect your devices confidently and conveniently with the GE 6 outlet surge protector with a 10-footcord. Featuring six protected outlets with 800 joules of surge protection, The surge protector transforms your regular outlet into an efficient powering station. For added safety, The surge protector includes an integrated circuit breaker to protect against overload and automatic shutdown technology to stop Power to your devices once surge protection expires. Its 10-foot power cord with flat Plug easily reaches behind desks, sofas, and other home and office furniture. Use the two keyholes on the back to mount the surge protector on a wall or desk to decrease clutter. The twist-to-close safety outlets keep your family and electronics safe by keeping foreign objects out when the outlet is not in use. Whether it's your home office, entertainment center or workspace, get the most from your outlet with the GE 6Outlet surge protector with a 10-foot cord.
feature_bullets: Expand your power – This GE 6 outlet surge protector with 10-foot cord provides power for your home and office electronics
Extra long cord – get optimal reach with the 10 foot extra long power cord with a flat plug at the end, which lets furniture sit closer to the wall
Protection – ensure the safety of your electronics with the 800 Joules protection rating and integrated circuit breaker

Functional – use the twist-to-close safety outlets to seal off outlets when not in use to avoid shock, and the surge protector can be mounted using the key holes on the back to better organize your power
Trusted Brand – GE is the #1 Brand in surge protection

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars15,415 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
